newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Federal Yugoslav court upholds Zajedno defeat.
newsitem.headline: Federal Yugoslav court upholds Zajedno defeat.

text.p: Yugoslavia's federal supreme court has rejected an appeal by the opposition Zajedno (Together) coalition to be reinstated as victors of municipal elections in Belgrade, the city election commission said on Tuesday.

The decision appeared to exhaust the legal avenues open to Zajedno which has conducted a three-week campaign of street demonstrations against what they say is election rigging by Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic's ruling socialist party.

The commission referred the Zajedno appeal to the federal court at the weekend after the Serbian supreme court upheld the opposition's disqualification in 33 seats because of unspecified "irregularities" in the November 17 vote.
The socialists and their allies will continue to control Belgrade with a majority of the 110 seats.
Thousands of opposition supporters and students demanding Milosevic's ouster were on the streets of the capital in a 23rd day of protests against election fraud.
The socialists have ignored the protests and Western calls, backed by threats of reprisals, for Zajedno's victory to be honoured in Belgrade and 14 other towns.
